alert.note: Alert for Weber (Utah) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued May 08 at 11:05PM MDT until further notice by NWS Saltlake
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Utah... Bear River At Corinne affecting Box Elder County. South Fork of The Ogden River Near Huntsville affecting Weber County. Sevier River Near Hatch affecting Garfield, Iron, Piute, Sevier and Kane Counties. .Recently warm temperatures and upstream dam releases will continue to result in increased river flows. Minor flooding is ongoing along the South Fork of the Ogden River near Huntsville, and along the Bear River near Corinna. For the Sevier River...including Hatch...Minor flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING FOR SNOWMELT REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL FURTHER NOTICE... * WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...South Fork of The Ogden River Near Huntsville. * WHEN...Until further notice. * IMPACTS...At 4.6 feet, low lying areas near the banks of the South Fork of the Ogden River below Causey Reservoir through the town of Huntsville will receive minor flooding. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 10:15 PM MDT Monday the stage was 4.6 feet. - Forecast...The river will fall below flood stage late this evening to 4.5 feet just after midnight tonight. It will then rise above flood stage tomorrow morning to 5.0 feet Friday morning. It will fall to 4.9 feet early Saturday morning then rise again. - Flood stage is 4.6 feet. &&
info.instruction: Even 6 inches of fast-moving flood water can knock you off your feet and a depth of 2 feet will float your car. Never try to walk, swim, or drive through such swift water. If you come upon flood waters, stop, turn around and go another way. Please report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement and request they pass this information to the National Weather Service when you can do so safely. Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued by Tuesday at 1200 PM MDT.
